bibl.title: Charles Barned v. J.H. McGraw. Petition for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory Holding Terms at Seattle, King County, in said Territory.
In the matter of the application of Charles Barnes For a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Judge of said Court, The petition of Charles Barnes respectively shows:

I. That he is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by one J.H. McGraw, Sheriff of King County, Washington Territory, at the County Jail in the City of Seattle in said King County.

II. That the cause or pretense of the restraint according to the best of the knowledge and belief of this applicant, is by vitue of a certain paper writing purporting to be a commitment issued by one G.W. Canfield a Justice of the Peace for Osceola Precinct, said King County.

III. That the said commitment is illegal in this: That the said Charles Barned has not been convicted or any offense whatever or was he charged with any offense whatever, nor had the said Justice of the Peace any jurisdiction or authority o issue the said ommitment or to try the said Charles Barnes.

IV. That said Charles Barned is not helf on any process issued on any final judgement of a court of competent jurisdiction not for any contempt of any court, officer or body having authority in the premises to commit not upon any warrant issued from any District Court Upon an indictment or information.

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to the said J.H. McGraw commanding him to have the body of said Charles Barnes before your honor at a time and place there in to be specified, to do and receieve what shall then and there be considered by your honor concerning him. Together with the time and cause of his detention, and said Writ, and that he may be restored to his liberty.
Struve, Haines + McMicken Attorney for Petitioner
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON, COUNTY OF KING } ss.

Charles Barnes being first duly sworn, on oath says: That he is the petitioner in the above entitled action; that he has heard the foregoing petition read, knows the contents thereof, and believes the same to be true; that he makes this affidavit because
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 6th day of January 1886
Maurice McMicken Notary Public in and for King County, Washington Territory
IN THE DISTRICT COURT, THIRD JUDICIAL DISTRICT, HOLDING TERMS AT SEATTLE
In re application of Chas. Barnes for a writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED JAN 6 1886 JAMES SEAVEY, CLERK By James Ludlow, Deputy Clerk.
